critique: This executive order pertains to the conversion of indefinite appointments to permanent positions within the field service of the Post Office Department. It prioritizes those appointed from competitive civil service registers and those returning from military service. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, expansion of executive power, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to have a slight impact on economic regulation by providing more job security to postal workers. It also seems to have a slight impact on social inclusion by prioritizing veterans.
